title: Megan Fox shares rare picture of Brian Austin Green and all her kids in adorable Disneyland trip
text:
The happy family were all dressed up (Picture: @meganfox)

Megan Fox got into the Halloween spirit early as she took her husband and three children to Disneyland.

Megan joined her husband Brian Austin Green, and three children Journey, three, Bodhi, five and Noah, seven, where they all dressed up ahead of the spooky holiday.

The actress’s littlest one was dressed as a red dinosaur, whilst her eldest son wore a bright pink wig and Bodhi, her middle son dressed as a skeleton.

She kept it simple with a black top, like her hubby, though she got into the Disneyland spirit with Minnie Mouse ears.

The 33-year-old took to Instagram to lament the difficulties of taking a family photo.

Night or day…Disneyland is awesome @meganfox

‘Halloween at @disneyland is always the most fun but can I get ONE family photo where everyone is looking at the camera and making a semi normal face??’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The struggle is real.

The actress shared a few snaps of their outing, including one photo of her children posing for the camera and sitting in from of a Ferris wheel,

Megan recently revealed that her eldest son Noah ‘sometimes likes to wear dresses.’

‘Sometimes, he’ll dress himself and he likes to wear dresses, sometimes,’ she explained on The Talk in September. ‘And I send him to a really liberal, hippy school, but even there – here in California, he still has little boys going, “Boys don’t wear dresses,” or “Boys don’t wear pink”.’

‘He just wore one two days ago to school, and he came home and I was like, “How was it? Did any of the friends at school have anything to say?”

‘And he was like, “Well, all the boys laughed when I came in, but I don’t care, I love dresses too much”.’

The actress went on to talk about Noah’s talent for drawing. ‘He designs, he draws outfits. He’s very talented. But he’s still six so, when I do fittings, like, I did one recently and I had this really beautiful yellow dress on, and he kept draping it in a way where he’s like, “If we do it like this, it looks like a diaper!”

‘I was like, “That’s not what we’re going for this time, but maybe next time!”‘ she added.
